required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: sdAb-based TRNT of Multiple Myeloma: a Feasibility Study
clinical_study.official_title: sdAb-based Targeted Radionuclide Therapy of Multiple Myeloma: a Feasibility Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to show that antiidiotypic sdAb are a new, sensitive, specific and non-invasive tool for imaging and therapeutic purposes and provides a rationale for their clinical evaluation as a personalized treatment option for MM patients expressing surface paraprotein.

primary_outcome.measure: Fraction of patients (n=5) for whom a sdAb could be generated that binds to the idiotype of the paraprotein.
primary_outcome.description: Reporting of the relative amount of patients for whom such sdAb could be successfully obtained

primary_outcome.measure: Amount of paraprotein-targeting sdAbs generated per patient and amount of sdAb families identified.
primary_outcome.description: Absolute amount of unique sdAbs obtained per patient and its average over all patients with successful generation of sdAb

primary_outcome.measure: Affinities of generated paraprotein-targeting sdAbs using BIAcore technology and ELISA techniques.
primary_outcome.description: Reporting of affinity (Kd) of selected sdAb per patient measured using BIAcore and ELISA techniques

secondary_outcome.measure: binding capacity to patient-derived myeloma cells (if available)
secondary_outcome.description: Binding of paraprotein-targeting sdAb to membrane-expressed paraprotein of multiple myeloma cells, obtained as leftover material from routinely performed bone marrow sampling in the 10 years after inclusion of the study subject, measured by mean fluorescence intensity in flow cytometry and/or semiquantitative scoring after immunohistochemistry staining of samples

intervention.intervention_name: Blood sampling and bone marrow analysis
intervention.description: Bone marrow sample analysis. A blood sampling of maximally 10 ml by venous puncture (serum)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients will only be included in the study if they meet all of the following criteria:
- Patients who have given informed consent
- Patients at least 18 years old
- Patients scheduled to undergo bone marrow sampling in clinical routine because of a clinically suspected or pathologically confirmed multiple myeloma.
Exclusion Criteria:
Patients will not be included in the study if one of the following criteria applies:
- Patients who cannot communicate reliably with the investigator
- Patients who are unlikely to cooperate with the requirements of the study
- Patients at increased risk of death from a pre-existing concurrent illness
- Patients who participated already in part I of this study
